articles.content:
Abolition of Part-time Job and Guarantee of Rights to Labor Urged in S. Korea 
    Pyongyang, November 4 (KCNA) -- The south Korean Railway Workers Union held a rally to vow an all-out struggle in Maroni Park in Seoul on Oct. 29 at which it demanded the abolition of the part-time job and the guarantee of rights to labor, according to the south Korean KBS.
 The organization made public a message to the government demanding it to meet ten demands concerning the guarantee of rights to labor.
 In the meantime, the federation of public transport and social service workers unions of south Korea held a meeting in the same place that day at which it strongly demanded the authorities repeal the part-time job and increase the public nature of the community.

Protocol Signed between DPRK and Russia 
    Pyongyang, November 4 (KCNA) -- A protocol of the 8th meeting of the Forestry Sub-committee of the Committee for the Cooperation of Trade, Economy and Science and Technology between the governments of the DPRK and Russia was signed in Amur, Russia on October 26.
 Present at the signing ceremony from the DPRK side were members of a delegation of the Ministry of Forestry led by Vice-minister Ri Jin Son and from the Russian side were Vice-Minister of Industry and Energy Ivan Matsorov, and officials concerned.

articles.content:
C. C., UAWK Meets
    Pyongyang, November 4 (KCNA) -- The 50th Plenary Meeting of the Central Committee of the Union of Agricultural Workers of Korea was held here on Thursday.
 The meeting discussed tasks to be fulfilled to firmly uphold and glorify the undying leadership exploits performed by President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il in the cause of building the UAWK and bring about a new turn in the work of the UAWK on the occasion of the 60th founding anniversary of the union. 
 A report was made by Kang Chang Uk, chairman of the C. C., the UAWK, to be followed by speeches. The reporter and speakers reviewed the successes and experience gained by the union in its work in the past true to the Songun revolutionary leadership of the Party and proposed tasks and measures to bring about a new turn in the work of the UAWK.    
 The meeting called on all organizations and officials of the UAWK to firmly build up the union as a permanent companion of the Party and Songun revolutionary ranks that make positive contributions to the socialist rural construction and the accomplishment of the revolutionary cause of Juche under the Songun revolutionary leadership of Kim Jong Il on the occasion of its diamond jubilee.

articles.title: DPRK Players Prove Successful in 4th East Asian Games

articles.content:
DPRK Players Prove Successful in 4th East Asian Games
    Pyongyang, November 4 (KCNA) -- The 4th East Asian Games have been under way in Macao of China since Oct. 29. 
 DPRK boys and girls bagged 4 gold medals, 5 silver medals and 12 bronze medals in matches held from Oct. 30 to Nov. 2.
 Hong In Sun and Choe Kum Hui won gold medals in women's doubles 10-meter platform diving, Ri Jong Song in men's floor exercises, Kang Yun Mi in women's vault and Kim Jong Su in men's 10-meter air pistol shooting.    
 O Jong Ae and Pak Hyon Suk carried off silver medals in the 58kg and 63 kg categories of women's weightlifting and Kim Chon Man and Ri Jong Nam in men's doubles 10-meter platform diving, Hong Su Jong in women's uneven bars and Ri Hae Yon in the women's balance beam. 
 Meanwhile, the DPRK women's gymnastic team bagged a bronze medal in the team event.    
 The games that will last till Nov. 6 drew at least 1,900 players from 9 countries and regions.

articles.title: Wreaths Laid before Bust of Kim Hyong Gwon
U.S. Forces' Transfer of Firing Range under Fire
articles.content:
Wreaths Laid before Bust of Kim Hyong Gwon
    Pyongyang, November 4 (KCNA) -- Wreaths were laid before the bust of ardent revolutionary fighter Kim Hyong Gwon in the Revolutionary Martyrs Cemetery on Mt. Taesong on November 4 on the occasion of his 100th birth anniversary.
 Seen standing before the bust was a wreath from Kim Jong Il. general secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea, chairman of the National Defence Commission of the Democratic People's Republic of Korea and supreme commander of the Korean People's Army.    
 Present at the wreath-laying ceremony were Vice-President Yang Hyong Sop of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly, Secretary Kim Ki Nam of the WPK Central Committee, Vice-Premier Ro Tu Chol, officials of the party and armed forces organs, working people's organizations, ministries and national institutions, servicepersons of the KPA and working people in the city.    
 Placed before the bust amidst the playing of the wreath-laying music were wreaths in the name of the WPK Central Committee, the Ministry of the People's Armed Forces, working people's organizations, ministries, national institutions, party and power and other bodies in Pyongyang.
 Written on the ribbons of the wreaths were letters reading "In memory of Comrade Kim Hyong Gwon, revolutionary fighter."
 On the same day, wreaths, bouquets and flowers were laid before his statues in Kim Hyong Gwon and Hongwon counties.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il Sends Gifts to Arirang Creators and Performers
articles.content:
U.S. Forces' Transfer of Firing Range under Fire
    Pyongyang, November 4 (KCNA) -- A spokesman for the Committee for the Peaceful Reunification of the Fatherland answering a question put by KCNA Friday accused the U.S. imperialist aggression forces of attempting to use Jik Islet in waters off Kunsan, North Jolla Province, as a substitute for the firing range in Maehyang-ri.  Their transfer of the firing range will neither change nor cover up their aggressive and bellicose nature, he noted, and continued: 
 The U.S. troops built a firing range in Maehyang-ri, Hwasong city, Kyonggi Province for their exclusive use and have since conducted madcap mock nuclear bomb-dropping exercises, bombing and firing drills almost everyday for the past 50 years, thus severely devastating the ecological environment in the region and inflicting unspeakable disasters and misfortune upon its inhabitants. 
 Enraged by the forces' moves for a war of aggression and atrocities, south Koreans have conducted dynamic actions demanding the U.S. forces' withdrawal and the closure of the U.S. military bases in different parts of south Korea.    
 Much upset by this, the U.S. is staging the farce of closing the Maehyang-ri firing range and transferring it to Jik Islet.    
 It is impossible to free the Korean Peninsula from the danger of war nor is it possible to prevent the same tragedy as what happened in Maehyang-ri as long as the U.S. imperialist aggression troops, chieftain of aggression, war, man-slaughtering and destruction, remain in south Korea.
 The spokesman denounced the south Korean bellicose forces for their thrice-cursed traitorous act of toeing the U.S. line and offering part of the inviolable territory of Korea to the U.S. forces.
